byline.original: By KIM BARKER and RUSS BUETTNER
byline.contributor: Yuhan Liu, Isvett Verde and Yeong-Ung Yang contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A review of state inspections shows widespread labor violations but also the difficulties of regulating an industry that operates mostly off the books.

headline.print_headline: Nail Salon Checks Show Abuses and Confusion
headline.main: Nail Salon Sweeps in New York Reveal Abuses and Regulatory Challenges

snippet: A review of state inspections shows widespread labor violations but also the difficulties of regulating an industry that operates mostly off the books.
abstract: Crackdown on nail salon industry by New York State labor officials results in hundreds of citations and orders to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars in damages and back wages to abused employees; investigation underscores challenges of regulating immigrant-run industry in which employees are intimidated by bosses who often have scant understanding of law.
